oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1996 October 26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with church members asking for prayers. Carl Porter speaks to the congregation as music begins to play behind him. As Carl Porter ends his speech, Billy Lemming plays guitar and sings. His song has the congregation standing and clapping along as he sings. As the music plays and members dance, a second camera crew comes close to record Spencer Evans as he removes a serpent from its box and handles. After he replaces his serpents, Members lay hands on Spencer Evans while Jamie Coots sings. Jamie Coots follows Spencer in handling. Bill Plefrey, Carl Porter and many others handle as well. After the music and dancing Carl Porter testifies with a serpent in hand. His testimony ends with more music and dancing. Jamie Coots takes to the pulpit to preach. His sermon is followed by the testimony of Spencer Evans. Bill Pelfrey preaches to the congregation for an extended period and is followed by more testimony from members of the church.
